No. 204959)} Sub: Role of Joint Advisors (Environment & Plantation) posted at ROs w.r.t Enumeration of trees, Identification of   Compensatory Afforestation areas, preparation of Feasibility Study Report, Evaluation of alternative alignment etc and in preparation of reply to the Essential Details Sought by Forest Departments. The DPR Consultant is expected to do the following activities: Work out appropriate plan for planting of trees, horticulture, floriculture on the surplus land of the Right of Way with a view to beautify the Highway and making the environment along the highway pleasing: ji. To undertake the detailed environment and social  impact assessment in accordance with the standards set by the Govt. of India/ Asian Development Bank/ World Bank iii. To identify the mitigation measures: iv. To provide additional input in the areas of performance indicators and monitoring mechanisms for environmental components during construction and operational phase of the project: However , it has been observed that the reports prepared/ submitted by DPR Consultants lack above details. In view of   this, State Forest   Departments and/or Integrated Regional Offices of   Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change (MoEFCC) seek various details from NHAI resulting into delays in project execution. 2 It has already been decided vide Office Order No. NHAl/11041/553/2021-Admn_ (E-58850)/3396 dated 17.01.2023 that the Joint Advisors (Environment & Plantation) will also undertake the work of Monitoring & Evaluation for compliance review appraisal related to mitigation works undertaken W.r.t Forest, Wildlife, CRZ and Environment Clearance etc. besides supervision of plantation activities: 3. In order to avoid delays in project execution on account of various details sought by State Forest Departments, Regional Officers must ensure active coordination among Project Directors, Joint Advisors / Advisor (Environment & Plantation) and DPR Consultants.
